alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 141 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges are reporting heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen and more rainfall is expected. Law enforcement is reporting flooding on some roadways in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Givhans Ferry State Park, Ladson, Hollywood, Ravenel, Ridgeville, Meggett, Cottageville, Givhans, Knightsville, Delemar Crossroads, Jedburg, Sangaree, College Park, Magnolia Gardens, Adams Run, Jacksonboro and Round O.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
